tool.name: nxtrim
tool.description: Software to remove Nextera Mate Pair adapters and categorise reads according to the orientation implied by the adapter location

param.name: jr
param.label: Try to merge overhands from R2 with R1

param.name: norc
param.label: Do NOT reverse-complement mate-pair reads (use this if your reads are already in FR orientation)

param.name: pmp
param.label: Preserve MPs even when the corresponding PE has longer reads

param.name: ipf
param.label: Ignore chastity/purity filters in read headers

param.name: sep
param.label: Output paired reads in separate files (prefix_R1/prefix_R2). Default is interleaved.

param.name: similarity
param.label: The minimum similarity between strings to be considered a match

param.name: minoverlap
param.label: The minimum overlap to be considered for matching

param.name: minlength
param.label: The minimum read length to output (smaller reads will be filtered)

tool.help: Required arguments: -1 [ --r1 ] arg read 1 in fastq format (gzip allowed) -2 [ --r2 ] arg read 2 in fastq format (gzip allowed) Allowed options: --justmp just creates the mp/unknown libraries (reads with adapter at the start will be completely N masked) --joinreads try to merge overhangs from R2 with R1 (default: no joining) --norc do NOT reverse-complement mate-pair reads (use this if your reads are already in FR orientation) --preserve-mp preserve MPs even when the corresponding PE has longer reads --ignorePF ignore chastity/purity filters in read headers --separate output paired reads in separate files (prefix_R1/prefix_R2). Default is interleaved --similarity arg (=0.85) The minimum similarity between strings to be considered a match. --minoverlap arg (=12) The minimum overlap to be considered for matching --minlength arg (=21) The minimum read length to output (smaller reads will be filtered)
